hedline.hl1: St. Maarten Gets Its Own Dialing Code

abstract.p: St Maarten gets own international telephone dialing code, 699-54 (S)

block.p: St. Maarten, the Dutch territory in the Caribbean, may not have its own island (it shares it with French St.-Martin), but it now has its own international dialing code for its telephone system. Anyone calling from another country must dial the international access code 011, plus the island's five-digit code, 599-54, and then the local number. For calls within St. Maarten, the number 54 must precede all local five-digit numbers. The tourist board suggests practicing by calling (599-54) 22337 for more information.

TRAVEL ADVISORY Correction: May 21, 2000, Sunday A report in the Travel Advisory column on May 7 about St. Maarten's new dialing code, 599-54, referred incorrectly to the use of an international access code ahead of it. The code 011 is only for those dialing from the United States.
